title: High packet loss since the patch
body:
http://logsoflag.com/#_eFYMIAL4Ss

^ previous game (7.18)

http://logsoflag.com/#RSbaQ_ezFP8

^ yesterday (7.17)

What do? Game is completely unplayable in this state :/

replies.body: Thanks for those logs!  Our [log reader](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/209765743-Connection-Troubleshooting-Log-Reader) is pretty useful too, and can offer tips based on your specific issue.  This packet loss might be due to an unstable connection, and I definitely want you to get back in-game!  The steps in our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide should help fix things up, but test it in a custom game!

1. Went physically close to my router (less than a ft). No change.
2. Reset my router both physically and using the control panel. No change.
3. Plugged in ethernet cable for part of the game. No change.

Some other people on Reddit posted about it in the bugs thread for this patch. Leads me to believe it's not on my end...

A connection issue is pretty common for an online game, there's no bug that I know of which would cause this.  It's important to continue going over each step of the connection guide to rule out possibilities and get it resolved.  Let me know if you have any questions!
Would you like my Tracert and maybe you can tell me whats up?
Sure!  What's the issue you're having specifically, though?  Use [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) for the trace, directing to 104.160.131.1 for about 5 minutes.

Thanks for that!  It looks like you're getting some massive packet loss early in this (on your second hop).  This would be ISP related, or router struggling to join a local network.  You'll still want to run through the steps in the [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) to troubleshoot router issues and settings, but give it a good power cycle as well first.

Once finished, give it another traceroute to see if things have improved.

I hope that helps!
Oh, don't bother, its all my isp...... ZZZZZZZZ, Thanks though for the reply

So annoying how they just dont care. Just always recommend some pointless connection issues link that doesnt do anything. Always try to say it's your connection problem when tons of people are all having the same problem randomly after a patch..

Connection issues a super common, and the guide is solid at ruling out a lot of causes and resolves issues in most cases.  Why do you feel that the guide is pointless, is there a way we can make it better?
Ok. It's solid at ruling out causes. But never solves anything when people are actually having problems. You just run off and say it's connection problems.
I also noticed packet loss all of a sudden today. I don't know if its my ISP since I checked everything and switched routers or what... East Coast CT
